doc.after: HMSÂ Tiger in her post-1918 configuration, with mainmast ahead of her third funnel. The most heavily armoured battlecruiser of the Royal Navy at the start of World War I (through which she was distinguished in the battles of Dogger Bank, Jutland, and Second Heligoland Bight), she was described by Sir John Keegan as "certainly the most beautiful warship in the world then, and perhaps ever".
